title: Kim Kardashian wants to have dinner with ‘courageous’ Greta Thunberg
text:
Kim’s a big fan of Greta’s (Pictures: Getty)

Kim Kardashian has opened up about young climate activist Greta Thunberg – and it turns out she’s a huge fan.

The mum-of-four, who recently spoke out about monitoring her kids on social media, described the 16-year-old as ‘such a brave and strong young woman.’

Adding that she’d love her kids to meet her, she pointed out that the activist is ‘so brave and courageous to stand up to these grown-ups that can be very scary and for her to be so open and honest is exactly what we need.’

She wants her kids to meet the young activist (Picture: Gotham/GC Images)

Speaking to Reuters, Kim said she would ‘absolutely’ like to go to dinner with Greta, adding: ‘I would really love to speak to her parents and to see how they’ve encouraged her. Did she always have that in her?’

Kim’s definitely not the first celeb to throw her support behind the activist, with Fatboy Slim recently remixing her iconic climate change speech with his 1998 banger Right Here, Right Now.

We never knew we needed this collab but we’re completely obsessed.

Back in September, the Swedish campaigner captured the world’s attention by blasting delegates at the United Nations conference for not doing enough to protect the environment.

‘You have stolen my dreams and my childhood with your empty words,’ she said, with various parts of her speech being sampled in Fatboy Slim’s track.

In the widely quoted speech, she went on to say: ‘This is all wrong. I shouldn’t be up here. I should be back in school on the other side of the ocean. Yet you have come to us young people for hope. How dare you.’

However, not everyone has been welcoming to the teenager’s message, with Piers Morgan recently mocking her on Good Morning Britain, launching into a ruthless impression of her.

Meanwhile, with Jeremy Clarkson branding her a ‘spoilt brat’, it seems families are struggling to agree, as the presenter’s daughter Emily slammed ‘middle-aged blokes’ who criticise and mock the campaigner.

She makes a good point.
